hero_title: A Living Eco Farm & Learning Space in South Lebanon
hero_desc: NUWA is a vibrant eco-farm rooted in the landscape of South Lebanon, where permaculture, regenerative agriculture, and rural tourism come together. Designed as an integrated living system, NUWA restores the land through sustainable farming, water harvesting, and native planting—while offering visitors a meaningful space to learn, reconnect, and experience nature in its purest form.
faq1_a:
Bring nature into any space — small or large:
Homeowners
Rooftops, balconies, backyards, private gardens — transform your home into a productive green space.
Restaurants & Cafés
Grow your own farm-to-table herbs, vegetables, and fresh produce all year round.
Schools
Create interactive educational gardens that support hands-on learning and environmental awareness.
Landowners / Developers
Design agricultural plots, edible landscapes, food forests, and eco-farm zones tailored to your land.
faq2_a:
A simple, guided process from idea to thriving farm:
Step 1: Consultation
Online or on-site - we explore your space, needs, and goals.
Step 2: Site Visit & Assessment
We evaluate sunlight, soil quality, water access, layout potential, and technical conditions.
Step 3: Custom Design & Plan
You receive a tailored layout, plant selection, irrigation strategy, and a full system design.
Step 4: Implementation
Choose to build it yourself with our guidance or let our team implement everything for you.
faq3_a:
A complete roadmap to launch and sustain your own productive green space:
• Custom farm layout and design plan
• Full planting strategy (annuals, perennials, herbs, etc.)
• Irrigation, composting, and soil improvement recommendations
• Seasonal planting calendar
• Detailed materials and supplies list
• Maintenance guidance
• Optional: ongoing support, training, and follow-up visits
about_hero_title: A regenerative eco-farm where land, learning, and nature come alive.
principles_text: At NUWA Eco-farms, every decision is guided by permaculture principles that respect the land, people, and resources. These principles help us design a farm that is resilient, productive, and educational.
p1_desc: NUWA Eco-farm began with deep observation of the site, its slope, sun path, seasonal winds, soil behavior, and local community rhythms—guiding every spatial and ecological decision.
p2_desc: NUWA Eco-farm prioritizes low-cost, natural construction materials like stone, timber, pallets, and earth, reducing dependence on industrial inputs.
p3_desc: NUWA Eco-farm's phasing strategy builds slowly, ensuring each layer is functional before scaling.
p4_desc: NUWA Eco-farm harvests rainwater, treats greywater, composts manure, and captures solar energy—converting waste into productive resources.
p5_desc: Organic waste is composted on-site. Greywater and materials are reused or repurposed across the farm.
p6_desc: Biodiversity is key. Mixed plantings, livestock, and cultural programming keep NUWA Eco-farm resilient socially and ecologically.
p7_desc: NUWA Eco-farm integrates food production, greenhouses, animals, and hospitality—creating economic, nutritional, and social value.
p8_desc: NUWA Eco-farm's layout follows natural movement paths and micro-zones, forming a coherent system that evolves organically.
p9_title: Use Edges and Value the Marginal
p9_desc: NUWA Eco-farm celebrates edges—between shade and sun, agriculture and wild space—as areas of productivity and experimentation.
p10_desc: Through modular grid systems and experimentation, NUWA Eco-farm adapts and improves based on what works seasonally and socially.
p11_desc: NUWA Eco-farm blends agriculture, education, recreation, and ecology—strengthening connections across systems.
p12_title: Creatively Use and Respond to Change
p12_desc: NUWA Eco-farm evolves through flexible design, seasonal adjustments, and community-driven feedback.
concept_p1:
The layout of NUWA Eco-farm is shaped around two interconnected loops that guide the visitor experience.
The recreational loop links communal spaces such as the family gathering area, play zone, pond, and farmhouse restaurant - inviting guests to unwind, connect, and enjoy the richness of local culinary and cultural traditions.
concept_p2:
The educational loop connects the farm's productive zones, including the greenhouse, kitchen gardens, and multi-functional grid. This path encourages visitors to engage with sustainable agriculture, explore local food systems, and experience traditional planting knowledge firsthand.
Together, these loops create a layered journey through the farm - one focused on recreation and cultural immersion, and the other on learning, participation, and deeper connection with the land.
systems_intro: NUWA Farms operates as an integrated ecosystem where water, energy, soil, plants, and people all work together. Each system supports the others to reduce waste and increase overall productivity.
system1_desc: Harvested rainwater and treated greywater are stored and redistributed through irrigation channels, ponds, and planted areas to reduce dependence on external sources.
system2_desc: Plant residues, kitchen scraps, and livestock manure are transformed into compost, enriching the soil's structure and long-term fertility.
system3_desc: Solar panels and efficient infrastructure power daily operations, lighting, and equipment with reduced environmental impact.
system4_desc: Greenhouses, open fields, and raised beds supply fresh produce to visitors, the farm kitchen, and the surrounding community.
plan_desc: The layout establishes a spatial arrangement that seamlessly integrates farm operations with the visitor experience. The layout features a large greenhouse divided into five sections, a series of 15 kitchen garden beds, composting bins, a livestock zone, family gathering spaces, a children’s play area, a central Saha, and a farm-to-table restaurant. Defined pathways framed by productive trees and native hedges guide guests through the site, with a central loop connecting and unifying all core functions.
products_hero_p: Explore our fresh, seasonal baskets sourced directly from our fields and prepared with care for your home.
basket_tagline: Fresh vegetables, milk, and eggs - picked and prepared each week as we would for our own family.
inc_item1: Seasonal farm vegetables (4-7 varieties depending on the harvest)
produce_note: Produce varies weekly based on seasonality and freshness.
practices_note: All produce is grown using regenerative and permaculture practices, with no synthetic chemicals - supporting soil health, biodiversity, and local food resilience.
summary_note: Your basket is freshly prepared each week from our farm's seasonal harvest.
visit_intro: At NUWA eco-farm, we welcome visitors to explore our living eco-farm, learn about regenerative agriculture, connect with animals, walk through our gardens, and enjoy a peaceful day in nature. Whether you’re coming as a family, a school group, or a curious traveler, NUWA eco-farm offers an experience rooted in learning, relaxation, and connection with the land.
visit_book_desc: Plan your experience at NUWA eco-farm and enjoy nature, agriculture, and community activities.
visit_type_A_list:
• Self-guided or guided tour
  • Access to gardens, greenhouses, walking paths
  • Meet the animals
  • Picnic spaces
visit_type_C_list:
• Age-tailored programs
  • Lessons on soil, plants, biodiversity
  • Interactive workshops
  • Guided tour included
visit_type_E_list:
• Meal at the farmhouse restaurant
  • Seasonal tasting menu
  • Cooking demonstrations
whatsincludedAnswer: <li>Guided tour of Nuwa Farms <li>Access to greenhouses & plant nursery<li>Hands-on planting / harvesting activit <li>Basket tasting / fresh produc <li>Safety & hygiene briefing
